SENT.plain: Achondroplasia is the most common condition associated with disproportionate short stature
Substantial information is available concerning the natural history and anticipatory health supervision needs in children with this dwarfing disorder
Most children with achondroplasia have delayed motor milestones, problems with persistent or recurrent middle-ear dysfunction, and bowing of the lower legs
Less often, infants and children may have serious health consequences related to hydrocephalus, craniocervical junction compression, upper-airway obstruction, or thoracolumbar kyphosis
Anticipatory care should be directed at identifying children who are at high risk and intervening to prevent serious sequelae
This report is designed to help the pediatrician care for children with achondroplasia and their families
